3. Sobolev spaces of integer and fractional orders
3.1. Isoperimetric problem for fractional perimeter
Let Ω be a bounded domain with smooth boundary ∂Ω and α ∈ (0, 1). The following set function was introduced in [68]:

Pα(Ω) =
∫_{Ω} ∫_{Rn\Ω} \frac{dx\,dy}{|x − y|^{n+α}}.

Later, Pα(Ω) was called the “fractional perimeter of Ω” and has attracted a lot of attention since.

By [68, Section 6], (see also [71, Section 11.10]), the best constant C in the isoperimetric inequality

Pα(Ω) ≤ C \; H^{n−1}(∂Ω)^{\frac{n−α}{n−1}}  (3.1)

is the same as the best constant C in the functional inequality

\Big(\int_{Rn} \int_{Rn} \frac{|u(x) − u(y)|^{q}}{|x − y|^{n+α}}\,dx\,dy\Big)^{1/q} ≤ 2^{1/q} C \; \|∇u\|_{L^1(Rn)},

where q = n/(n − α) and u ∈ C^∞_0(Rn).

By [68, p. 333],

C ≤ \frac{n\, v(n−1+α)/n}{n\, α(1 − α)} \Big(H^{n−1}(∂B1)\Big)^{\frac{n−α}{n−1}}.

The constant factor on the right, although explicit, is hardly best possible.

Problem. Find the best value of the isoperimetric constant C in (3.1).
